meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Nigeria.
meanings.sent1: In Nigeria, you can buy many things with just a few kobos.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for kobos at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The kobos in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand kobos.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kobos sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The kobos gracefully leaped over the grassy plains.
meanings.sent2: I saw a herd of kobos grazing peacefully in the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to imitate the kobos' elegant movements.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as alert as a kobos scanning the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The swift kobos dashed away from the approaching predator.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical fight or brawl.
meanings.sent1: The two boys kobosed behind the school after an argument.
meanings.sent2: I don't want to kobos with anyone; I prefer peaceful solutions.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully kobosed over the last cookie in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The teams kobosed fiercely on the field for the championship title.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors could hear the loud kobosing coming from the backyard.
